result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Darrell C. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:36 pm - Defendant Darrell C. Peterson in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Amended Information.  Defendant pleads guilty to all three counts.  Plea questionnaire and DPA filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of counts 2 and 3 but defers judgment on Count 1 and accepts the DPA.  Sharon Peterson/Michlig/Schultz/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  Defense submits to Court Exhibit 1 (Character Reference Letters) and Exhibit 2 (Defense Eval) - Sealed by Court - Marked & Rec'd.  Court sets $5,000 sig bond same conditions as cash bond.  
Court Sentence CC
WHS/POP 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Comply with all provision of the CHIPS order - must sign release for PO to obtain information from Social Services 
Jail 40 days - Jail credit 6 days - W/Huber for all purposes - To commence on/before 5-15-15 at 4 pm
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given - The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

records.addlTxt: 08:38 am - Defendant Darrell C. Peterson in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Detective Shannon Murray/Sworn/Direct by Michlig - Defense stipulate to ID of defendant/Cross by Schultz.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Schultz files Request for Substitution.  08:55 am - In Recess for State to prepare Information.  08:59 am - Back on record.  State files Information.  Schultz in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters a not guilty plea.  Court will not address motion to modify bail - new judge will need to address.  Schultz/Michlig statement to modification regarding not allowing defendant to be on premises of the family home.  Court will modify bond to allow defendant to be at the family home when victim is not there - Social Services to be notified 24 hours in advance of visit to home.

Preliminary hearing on January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

1:17 p.m. Defendant Darrell C. Peterson in court, in custody, with attorney Henry Reid Schultz. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in receipt of complaint; waives reading. Schultz argues reduction in cash bond. Michlig statement. Court statement-denies motion for change to bond. If bail posted, defendant requests to live with mother in MN. Court states no restriction in that regard. 1:23 p.m. adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.
